judgement.reason: An antihypertensive is any agent that lowers blood pressure, but not all antihypertensives are approved drugs for hypertension. Some may be experimental or not yet approved for clinical use.
An antihypertensive drug is intended to treat hypertension, but not all antihypertensive drugs may be approved for use, and some approved drugs for hypertension may have other primary indications.
An antihypertensive is a drug used to treat high blood pressure, but not all antihypertensives are approved drugs for hypertension as some may be experimental or not yet approved for use.

An antihypertensive drug is a type of medication used to treat high blood pressure, but not all antihypertensive drugs are necessarily approved for hypertension. Approval can vary by region and regulatory authority.

An antihypertensive drug is specifically used to treat high blood pressure, but not all antihypertensive drugs may be approved for hypertension, and there may be drugs approved for hypertension that are not strictly classified as antihypertensive.

Antihypertensive medication refers to any drug used to treat high blood pressure, whereas an approved drug for hypertension specifically refers to drugs that have received regulatory approval for this use. Not all antihypertensive medications may be approved drugs.

An antihypertensive drug is specifically used to treat high blood pressure, but not all antihypertensive drugs may be approved for use in every case of hypertension. Approval can vary based on regulatory bodies and specific drug formulations.
An antihypertensive drug is any medication used to treat high blood pressure, but not all antihypertensive drugs may be approved for hypertension in every region or under every regulatory body.

An antihypertensive drug is specifically designed to treat high blood pressure, but not all approved drugs for hypertension fall under the category of antihypertensive drugs. Some drugs may be approved for hypertension as a secondary effect or off-label use.
